author: sky.cactus
content: What is the selector to use for legacy transactions?

author: djrtwo
content:
0 in beacon chain. Just correct bytes for execution layer in api

See  `transaction_envelope()`  and the above defined selectors under option 1. in head comment here

https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/2608

author: sky.cactus
content: Right, my argument is we should use 0 for multi-chain transactions and 3 for single-chain transactions because that is what I'm going to *eventually* lobby for on the execution layer once we get clearance for execution layer changes again.

author: sky.cactus
content: It would suck to have the consensus client use 0 for both today and then have this confusing situation in 12 months when the execution layer starts differentiating the types with 0 and 3.
